com.link_intersystems.beans

Interface BeanEventType

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JavaBeanEventType

    public interface BeanEventType
    Author:
    Ren√© Link <rene.link@link-intersystems.com>

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addListener(Object bean, Object listener)
      Adds the given listener to the provided bean if it supports this BeanEventType.
      String getName()
      The event name.
      boolean isApplicable(Class<?> listenerClass) 
      boolean isApplicable(Object listener)
      Returns true if the given listener is applicable for this BeanEvent, which means that it can be added or removed.

      void removeListener(Object bean, Object listener)

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        The event name.

      • newBeanEvent

        BeanEvent newBeanEvent(Object bean)

      • isApplicable

        boolean isApplicable(Object listener)
        Returns true if the given listener is applicable for this BeanEvent, which means that it can be added or removed.

      • isApplicable

        boolean isApplicable(Class<?> listenerClass)

      • addListener

        void addListener(Object bean,
                 Object listener)
          throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Adds the given listener to the provided bean if it supports this BeanEventType. The provided bean supports this BeanEventType if it declares an add method for the given listener's type. Otherwise it throws an UnsupportedOperationException.
        Parameters:
        bean - the bean to add the listener to.
        listener - the listener to add.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the provided bean dosen't declare an add method for this BeanEventType.

      • removeListener

        void removeListener(Object bean,
                    Object listener)
             throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Removes the given listener from the provided bean if it supports this BeanEventType. The provided bean supports this BeanEventType if it declares an remove method for the given listener's type. Otherwise it throws an UnsupportedOperationException.
        Parameters:
        bean - the bean to remove the listener from.
        listener - the listener to remove.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the provided bean dosen't declare a remove method for this BeanEventType.
